decks.notes: This deck revolves around utilizing Azusa, Lost but Seeking's ability to play multiple lands per turn to ramp into powerful threats and control the game. The deck includes cards such as Exploration, Burgeoning, and Courser of Kruphix to accelerate land drops, as well as Crucible of Worlds and Ramunap Excavator to recur lands from the graveyard. The deck aims to generate value through cards like Oracle of Mul Daya and Sylvan Library, while also being able to tutor up key pieces with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Expedition Map. Ultimately, the goal of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with lands and big threats like Primeval Titan and Emrakul, the Promised End while controlling the game with lands like Maze of Ith and Glacial Chasm.

This deck revolves around aggressively playing small and efficient creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to maintain a steady stream of pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Blood Moon and Eidolon of the Great Revel. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Goblin Guide, and Sulfuric Vortex, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of utility lands like Ramunap Ruins and Mishra's Factory provides additional reach and resilience. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless onslaught of creatures and burn spells to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells, interaction, and efficient creatures to disrupt your opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady offensive pressure. Plagon, Lord of the Beach serves as the commander, providing a powerful creature that can help control the board and provide additional card advantage. The deck includes a mix of counterspells like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Mana Leak to disrupt your opponent's plays, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile to deal with threats. Efficient creatures like Spell Queller and Restoration Angel offer additional disruption while putting pressure on the opponent. The goal is to control the game while gradually chipping away at the opponent's life total to secure victory.

This deck focuses on combining aggressive plays with the flexibility of having two commanders to maximize efficiency and adaptability. By utilizing cards that allow for quick mana generation, card draw, and disruption, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game. The inclusion of various tutors and graveyard recursion spells enhances consistency and enables powerful combo plays. Strategic use of removal spells and disruption ensures control over the pace of the game, while the partner commanders offer a diverse range of abilities to suit different situations. Overall, the deck is designed to be fast-paced, versatile, and relentless in its pursuit of victory in a competitive 1 vs 1 environment.
